review.title: Very clean and modern hotel.
review.reviewText: Only complaints we had were the size of the room, or lack thereof.  The room was very small and hard to move around in because of the size.  We also had a person working the front desk who was very rude and discourteous.  Aside from that one person though, the rest of the staff was very helpful and pleasant.
Wonderful hotel! Very helpful staff, comfortable rooms.

review.title: Quite small room
review.reviewText: It is in the center of the downtown. Quite expensive room but the room is small.

review.title: Nice newly decorated hotel.
review.reviewText: It was a very updated hotel.  Very nicely decorated.  The room was quite small but it told that in the ad.  The location was close to walking to the downtown but also not too far from shelters.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel,  super friendly staff, very clean and comfortable.

review.title: Nice Hotel not best location
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly staff, great breakfast buffet. The "view" was not a view at all. We were looking at a run down building across the street. I would not base your stay off the "view" you might get.

review.title: Nice, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Clean room, excellent location: close to Market and Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are small, but you have what you need

review.title:
Value in an 








Value and Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is well located to transportation, shopping, and sights.  Very close to Market Street where you find many buses and trolley cars. Close walk to cable cars. Less than 2 blocks is the Powell stop for BART...great connection to and from airport. I recommend buying a Clipper Pass for ease in using transportation...available at airport and Walgreen drugstores. Dining places are to be had throughout the neighborhood.  The hotel has quite an adequate breakfast room, serving from 6 to 10 am daily and staffed with exceptionally friendly staff members.  Some reviews noted many homeless in this neighborhood. Yes, there are some homeless around; however, I was never bothered by any of them coming and going at the hotel which is quite secure.  Much of downtown SF has a homeless issue; it's just part of the local color. Didn't have a good meal in SF.............avoid the Big 4 on Nob Hill....mediocre food at elevated prices and attitude-soaked waiters. Food at Hotel Zetta...less than mediocre at inflated prices coupled with thick attitude.  Best bargain in town...crab and shrimp sandwiches at stalls at Fisherman's Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness, quietness, location, decorations in common places
review.locationRemarks: easy access to transportation to all major sights and attractions

review.title: Close to restaurants, sites.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Staff was excellent. Breakfast was terrific. Close to restaurants and city landmarks.

review.title: Hit a Home Run!
review.reviewText: On a recent trip to San Francisco for a Giants game, we decided to make it a weekend get-a-way.  The Hampton Inn was the perfect choice. We were able to walk to and from the game, even though it was a night game. The location was ideal. The hotel staff was warm and welcoming. Our room was spotless! A bit on the small side but comfortable. Although the Giants lost...we won with our choice of Hampton Inn:)
review.negativeRemarks: The room was quite small, however functional.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel service is great and the rooms were clean. Can't say the same about some areas around the hotel but besides that it was worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean. Close to Bart/Muni station and other parts of downtown San Francisco aren't that far away.
review.locationRemarks: Location is nearby many great areas, and blue bottle coffee is around the building, but the immediate vicinity often has many homeless people.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown SF.
review.reviewText: Lots of shopping center and restaurants near the hotel. Very comfortable clean room.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: No where to  park and valet was $64 a night. Room was tiny. Had a desk jammed next to the bed and a chair jammed in between. Couldn't even walk thru that side or sit in the chair it was so close. TV was hung on the wall on  left side of the room and you couldn't even turn it to get a better view.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. Continental breakfast was very good!

review.title: Nice hotel but not in a good area
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nice, staff is great, comfortable bed.  Everything was clean.

The location is bad, it's located in the middle of what is known as the "tenderloin area" in San Francisco.  No basic parking available through the hotel.  Only valet at $60 per night.

review.title: Tidy, cozy, great location and breakfast.
review.reviewText:
Everything was very clean and organized. I was at a conference at the Moscone center so the location was perfect. Breakfast included a large variety options and was delicious.
The ladies in the kitchen even made me a goodie bag for my flight before I left. 
Thanks so much!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff friendliness and how clean everything was.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish the roof was available more hours. It would also be nice if they had some lounge chairs up there.
review.locationRemarks: Very central and convenient. Shopping, restaurants and Moscone center a few blocks away.

review.title: Unsafe to stay here
review.reviewText: After i checked in about to go to the room there were couple of homeless in the elevator and good thing about this you need to get a key in the elevator in order to go to the room , one guest called fromt desk to come and ask those homeless to get out on way out he said he doing business here seriuos he drunk and he also tried  to hit me but luckily it was not happened. Im very scared because i didnt expect this to happened in Hampton inn hotel after that hotel GM called me to apologize he also mentioned that homeless were everywhere you go in this area but i think they not supposed to be in the hotel, hotel need to be safe place to stay anyway he asked me if i need a new hotel well i told him im not moving anywhere but make sure you have security at the door will be fine for me however the next day i still see the other homeless tried to get into the elevator also i never seen any one of security of my whole stay so definitely will never come back or recommend to people. Moreover we do a valet there and my rental car got hit and run fortunately i bought a full cover insurance so no need to do anything i cant imagine that if im not have insurance i need to deal with police and other and my vacation ruined so i hope this worst experienced help people to be aware of this hotel management . Ps i had ask for late check out as we had such a terrible experience there guess what hotel were full even i willing to pay for half day  i still need to get out of there. Good luck

review.title: Dirty dirty dirty.
review.reviewText: Outside was disgusting feces on front walkway. Got to our room pulled back the top cover and almost lost it. I called asked for all new linen, done. No apologie no offer of any restitution or change in rooms. Just pathetic night. Would never recommend to even an enemy.

review.title: Staff was amazing
review.reviewText: Rooms were very small,  everything was great just rooms much smaller than other Hilton hotels that I have stayed in,  staff was amazing!

managementResponses.response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time sharing your experience with Hampton Inn San Francisco Downtown on TripAdvisor. I am very happy to hear that you had a good time and that my team was able to provide you with good service! Please come stay with again soon on a future trip to the Bay Area!

review.reviewText: I had the best experience at the Hampton Inn Downtown/hConvention. The staff was wonderful from check-in (11 pm) to check-out. Totally customer centered, when I called the desk to ask for tour suggestions, they not only suggested a tour but reserved a spot for me which I enjoyed.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed my room, especially the bathroom. I enjoyed the lobby and was happy returning everyday from a full day out and about.
review.negativeRemarks: Sometimes there was a line at the desk to ask questions because only one person was there to answer calls, check-in and check-out. Homeless at entry.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Conventions Center. Easy walk to trolley Powell.

review.title: Great hotel you wouldn't expect
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for a conference. This hotel was well price and just blocks from the Moscone Center. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The room was perfect. It had a safe and a small refrigerator, neither of which I expected but we're welcome additions.  The bathroom was good sized and both it and the room were clean.

review.title: great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Good shopping and restaurants.  Walking distance to many sites!

review.title: Elevators from Hell
review.reviewText: You are assiggened an elevator that works with your floor and room. It was like playing Russion roulette with the wrong elevator opening that does not accept you key.

review.title: Expensive valet parking
review.reviewText: Located near a lot of shopping stores. Most expensive parking I've seen in San Francisco $60.00/day. Small rooms but clean.

review.title: Nice location, noisy bar just outside of the hotel
review.reviewText: Eggs.  Twice I have visited, and twice the promised eggs did not appear at breakfast.  Finally got to the person in the kitchen who indicated the stove broke, the supplier did not provide them, etc.   One wonders about the number of chickens in northern California . . .
review.negativeRemarks: Sound abatement should be considered carefully, as the bar owner is likely not to cooperate.  And the hotel guest should not be told "just wait awhile

review.title: Relaxing walk from Hotel to Moscone
review.reviewText: Came in earlier at 12 noon but checking time is 3 PM so concierge good enough to store our luggages until we came back from the Fancy Food Show at 6 PM.
review.positiveRemarks: 10 minutes walk to the Moscone Convention Centre.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is good but need more selection.

review.title: okay for business
review.reviewText:
Parking for valet was over priced, but the security staff recommended a good parking lot for the weekend. I was disappointed that the advertised roof access was closed due to maintenance. The room was a lot smaller than I thought it would be. no room to maneuver around the bed. Also the bed was on wheels, so it kept sliding away from the wall/headboard.

The breakfast was closed up by 9:15 on the Saturday we were leaving, so we couldn't grab a quick coffee. :(

The lobby, elevator and view were all great. The place was clean, likely because it's new. 
Short stays for 1 are perfect for this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: There's a mall right down the street and a great place to eat breakfast, called Dotties around the corner. It's only a street south of Market.

review.title: If you need to be downtown SF...
review.reviewText: Face lifted hotel right near Powell BART. Perfect to stay close to shopping and NYE festivities. Next to Westfield, Blue Bottle. Occasionally pungent on the outside, but comfortable on the inside. Reasonable price for downtown location. Pretty good service. Check-in before 3 a no-no. Late check-out is noon.

review.title: A very nice hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for two nights. The room was very clean and quiet. Breakfast was very yummy. I have nothing to complain about. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay in downtown.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Very good location, close to everything;  walking distance to Union Square, Bart station, Westfield,  Nordstrom and cable car. But just be aware when you go out and ignore some panhandlers. Overall, We will still stay in this hotel  next time we come back here in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: It's new and TV is big enough, and I like their washroom cuz' it's so spacious. Cris in front desk is very helpful and very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The housekeeping  don't clean our room consistently and some staff needs to more energetic except Cris.
review.locationRemarks: So many things and so many places to go. It's my first time here and Union square is so big. I like shopping so this is the best place  for me.

review.title: Nice location near Union square..
review.reviewText: Because construction next door started at 5 AM, the heating element was very loud, bed was sqeaky, and breakfast area capacity did not seem to meet the demands of the number of people, we rated this hotel as a 2. However, the hotel location and cleanliness was nice.  And the staff was exceptional!

review.title: convenient
review.reviewText: Quiet and comfort. Awesome and really accessible to all.

review.title: Downtown
review.reviewText: Te staff and hotel were excellent but stepping outside of the hotel was another story. Homeless people all around and even saw someone outside our window using the bathroom in the curb! And I was pretty disappointed with the parking situation, $65 per night for Vallet! It would have been nice if we were informed about that or at least have Validation voucher for near by parking.
The location is perfect but you need to stay away from the 6th street. The air conditioner in the room is very noisy. And the the breakfast place is sometimes too crowded.

review.title: Great downtown hotek
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel, friendly staff, close to the BART.

review.title: Nice hotel close to transportation
review.reviewText: Within 2 block of BART, F-line, shopping and Moscone center.  Desk staff helpful in printing boarding passes.

review.title: Clean ,confortable hotel
review.reviewText: Close to the shopping area. Near Powell Station. Clean room. Ok breakfast and staff. Nice view in the morning.

review.title: Excellent for price!
review.reviewText:
Hotel Staff was amazing. Courteous, friendly, always there to help and answer your questions. 5 stars for that and I really think this hotel deserves all the credit because of their staff. 

Facilities: OK for the price. Breakfast is always crowded, although free i.e. included in price, which is rare in SFO downtown. Walking distance to many locations. Uber ride to many places is cheap. Rooms are very small but has a fridge. Lounge downstairs is nice... they let you get your own wine etc. to enjoy after a hectic day. Hotel is overall clean. Room A.C ducts could be a bit more cleaner.. but overall, nice looking rooms and comfortable beds and stay

Location: Really good.. specially w price point. Take Uber to anywhere.. walk to market street.. union square.. and ride to pier 33, 39 etc.. is less than 15 minutes.  

Parking: was expensive.. but that's everywhere in SFO. This was actually cheaper than other places, and 24/7 valet - WOW. Specially if you want to take you care in and out several times during the day - was very useful

nice room but noise isolation is an issue.
i would suggest a room layout where the space is better used.

review.title: Noisy!
review.reviewText: Night club keeps you up all night if you are on the wrong side of the hotel.  I was on the 10th floor, and the nightclub could be hear clearly even in the bathroom with the bedroom plus 10 floors to the ground between us.  Monday night and Thursday nights I was at the mercy of the club noise.  I can't imaging what the weekends might be like.
review.negativeRemarks: Shut down the night club or have San Francisco adopt some reasonable noise ordinances.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the edge between the nice touristy areas and the bad parts of town.  It is dirty outside with questionable types wandering around at night.

review.title: Lots of homeless, didn't honor reservation
review.reviewText: First, this hotel is about 1/2 block from a VERY sketchy area (6th St.) and my wife and daughter were quite nervous. Lots of homelessness, drugs and prostitution just down the street. The hotel itself is fine but the service is not good. My 2 bed reservation was given away (I checked in at 5:30) and they only had a king room left so the three of us were very crowded. Their excuse was that Expedia reservations don't guarantee rooms. Whatever. There is a very loud club at street level so steer clear of the lower floors. And the rooms are very tiny! This would be ok for a business trip but definitely not for families.

review.title: Good hotel-bad and loudly neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel is in good condition, pretty secure even inside, but the staff is unfriendly must of them. They put in 9th floor facing a bar with the must louder music you can imagine, close at 4 am. They should do something with the windows

review.title: Hampton Downtown
review.reviewText: The room was spotless.  San Francisco is loud into the late, late hours of the night.  Even being on the 12th floor brought the dance club into my room, so be prepared.  The rooms are very small. I had a King with no chair or desk.
review.positiveRemarks: It is a new hotel, thus the pillows and beds are very comfortable.

review.title: Great location near my event
review.reviewText: I had just had a terrible hotel experience so I was a bit wary about this stay. I was pleasantly surprised by the accommodations. The room looked newly renovated. It was a modern clean look and feel.

review.title: Downtown surprise
review.reviewText:
Stayed on night and driving downtown was a bit worried as looked not so good
but when go to hotel it was great. Very clean
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is $60 bit pricey but had to park car safely so had to pay
review.locationRemarks: was perfect for where we needed to be downtown for a concert for the night!

review.reviewText: Very easy to get to bus tours from here. Walkable to and from much of the downtown area. My first trip to San Francisco. Great stay. Only negative is that it is very near the Tenderloin district and might not be safe to be outside after dark.

review.title: Great time. Quiet.
review.reviewText: Scary & difficult to find parking access, but staff, once we found them, was great.

review.title: check in
review.reviewText: argument on policy to use credit card with same name as reservation. name on reservation was William, name on credit card was bill, finally was able to use card.  could not change 100 dollar bill at 8:00 at night. green room on roof was closed, could not use that.     morning of check out, only 1 towel in bathroom to use for 2 people. did not vacuum room floor for 3 days. no computer room to print out boarding passes for departure, had to go to a libray

review.title: SF Hampton
review.reviewText: Hotel was really nice a little small for a family of 4 but got the job done. Only down side is high homelessness around property

review.title: nice hotel but i would never stay there again
review.reviewText:
The rooms are new, clean, and too small.  
There is not enough space in the rooms:  
  the coffee pot is in the bathroom; no room anywhere else
  a medium sized suitcase cannot lay flat in the closet where the luggage caddie is because the closet is too small
  there is no other place for the luggage caddie without tripping over it.
  the AC unit blows ice cold air directly onto your feet in bed; it's only 2 feet away
Other than that, the hotel is very nice.

I cannot recommend it or ever stay there again for two reasons:
1.  the hotel is located in a demilitarized zone, one block from XXX, drug dealers, and check cashing places.
2.  they do not have room service.  there is no way to get delivery without ordering $20+ worth of food, no room service means that you have to venture out into a terrible neighborhood at night.
review.positiveRemarks: clean room, cozy, very nice shower, decent people.
review.negativeRemarks: this place must have a kitchen or a relationship with a 24x7 restaurant with no minimum delivery.  without that, this hotel is completely useless.
review.locationRemarks: nothing but death in the immediate area.

review.reviewText: Rooftop terrace was closed so could not see city view.

review.title: New hotel,  very clean
review.reviewText: All new, very clean, comfortable bed and very nice linens. Nice bathroom with walk in shower. Room is small but very functional. Large AC unit for size of room makes you feel the blowing of the AC. Minimal lobby experience.

review.title: Nice, clean, new hotel.
review.reviewText: It's always a pleasure to stay at a new hotel - clean, comfortable, and up-to-date. My only gripe is that the room wasn't quite big enough for the King-size bed - not enough room for the desk and chair. Put a smaller queen-size bed in the room and it would be close to perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the view, great black-out window shade, comfortable bed, comfortable desk chair, and stand-up shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish there was access to the HDMI inputs on the TV so I could connect my iPad or laptop to it to watch Hulu or Netflix.

review.reviewText: Hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to  Union Square and Moscone (was in town for a conference) - which was great because I could get around without a car.  Hotel is brand new, love the decor.  Free breakfast and internet was a plus.  Will definitely stay here again next time I am in town.

review.title: Good location reasonable rates
review.reviewText: Great staff. Cassidy is awesome! Clean comfortable facilities nice decor & free breakfast & coffee. Location is good but a lot of homeless in area. But that is common to that area generally so it is of no fault to the hotel. I would definitely stay there again.
